sentence.Network_en: Young and old saw in him an implacable opponent of apartheid.
sentence.Network_cn: 无论老少都看出他是种族隔离制度的坚决反对者。

sentence.Network_en: He praised her role in the struggle against apartheid.
sentence.Network_cn: 他称赞了她在反种族隔离制的斗争中发挥的重要作用。

sentence.Network_en: The apartheid system which enshrined racism in law still existed.
sentence.Network_cn: 以法律保护种族主义的种族隔离制度依旧存在。

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1940s: from Afrikaans, literally separateness', from Dutch apart 'separate' + -heid (equivalent of -hood)

entry.tran: （南非曾经施行的）种族隔离制
entry.def: Apartheid was a political system in South Africa in which people were divided into racial groups and kept apart by law.

example.ex: He praised her role in the struggle against apartheid.
example.tran: 他称赞了她在反种族隔离制的斗争中发挥的重要作用。

means.word_mean: 1. a social policy or racial segregation involving political and economic and legal discrimination against non-whites; the former official policy in South Africa
